title: Ancient Greece
climate: Warm Mediterranean, best in spring or autumn
description: Wander ruins, attend classic theater performances, and taste early Mediterranean cuisine in a world of myths and philosophers.

reviews.comment: Amazing experience! So much history.
Beautiful, but a bit crowded during festivals.

title: Ancient Egypt: Giza & the Nile
climate: Hot desert climate; mornings and evenings are cooler
travelTips: Dress modestly and cover up from the sun
Book a local guide for safe navigation
description: Explore pyramid construction sites, sail the Nile in a reed boat, and witness the grandeur of pharaonic processions.

reviews.comment: A surreal experience seeing the pyramids being built.
Unforgettable, but bring a good hat and patience for the heat.

title: Jurassic Coastal Delta
location: What will become the Dorset Coast, UK
climate: Humid, warm subtropical with dense ferns and cycads
travelTips: Follow safety guide at all times
description: Witness colossal dinosaurs roam the shoreline, gather fossilized ammonites, and explore primeval forests under a sky of prehistoric constellations.

reviews.comment: Awe-inspiring — pure raw nature and bone-shaking footsteps!
Perfect for paleontology enthusiasts and adventurers.

title: Renaissance Florence
climate: Mild Mediterranean; pleasant spring and autumn
description: Meet master artists, attend exclusive workshops, and stroll cobblestone streets full of new ideas, inventions, and exquisite art.

reviews.comment: Brilliant art and lively debates in the piazzas—felt like I stepped into a painting.
Crowded ateliers, but seeing live masterpieces was worth it.

title: Medieval Kyoto
climate: Temperate with distinct seasons; cherry blossoms in spring
travelTips: Obey local courtesies, especially in temples
Learn basic etiquette for geisha districts
description: Experience serene temple rituals, samurai sword demonstrations, and traditional tea ceremonies in an age of discipline and artistry.

reviews.comment: Incredibly atmospheric — the tea ceremonies were mesmerizing.
Beautiful gardens, though some areas require strict observance of customs.

title: Viking Age Fjordlands
climate: Cool maritime; unpredictable weather; good summers
travelTips: Secure travel permits for fjord excursions
description: Sail longships into narrow fjords, trade at bustling shore markets, and learn ancient crafts by firelight with seasoned crews.

reviews.comment: Epic voyages and hearty feasts—very immersive!
A rugged adventure; bring sea-stable gear.

title: Tenochtitlan: The Aztec Capital
climate: High-altitude subtropical; cool nights and mild days
description: Explore an island metropolis of canals, towering temples, and bustling markets, where tribute, artistry, and ritual meet daily life.

reviews.comment: The markets were vibrant and richly scented—so much color and craft.
A powerful civilization—some sites require careful cultural sensitivity.

title: Victorian London: Jack’s Lighter Side
climate: Cool, damp maritime with foggy mornings
travelTips: Carry a warm coat and umbrella
Hire a licensed guide for health precautions
description: Ride hansom cabs, visit steam-powered exhibitions, and navigate gaslit alleyways—an era of invention, opulence, and shadowy secrets.

reviews.comment: Fascinating museums and steam exhibits; a bit chilly but atmospheric.
Crowded and smoky; recommend quieter Victorian neighborhoods.

title: Roaring Twenties: New York City
climate: Temperate; hot summers and cool winters
travelTips: Be mindful of social norms and land ownership
description: Dance at roaring jazz clubs, watch daring new films, and experience the excitement of a city booming with commerce and culture.

reviews.comment: Clubs were the highlight — jazz at night, skylines by day.
Great energy but be prepared for busy streets and fast living.

title: Mars Colony: New Dawn (2145)
climate: Thin atmosphere; cold with localized controlled habitats
travelTips: Be comfortable with enclosed habitats and high-tech travel
description: Visit advanced bio-domes, experience low-gravity recreation, and learn pioneering terraforming techniques from future colonists.

reviews.comment: Incredible technology and a perspective-changing landscape.
A once-in-a-lifetime trip — the habitat design was impressive.
